event.title: March 30, 2009 NEWARK — Wess Henry, who lost

data.event: By KENT MALLETT Advocate Reporter March 30, 2009 NEWARK — Wess Henry, who lost his home to foreclosure last year, was fishing for a way to change his luck.

event.title: opened Drowned Worm Bait Shop on Friday 13th of March

data.event: He hopes his fortunes change after he opened Drowned Worm Bait Shop on Friday 13th of March.

event.title: closed its Western Avenue business in January

data.event: Henry and his son, Matt, are co-owners of the business at 197 N. Cedar St.Henry purchased the inventory of Newark Live Bait, which closed its Western Avenue business in January.

event.title: a fishing trip a few months ago

data.event: The unlikely chain of events started when Matt Henry started planning for a fishing trip a few months ago.

event.title: said was the largest bicycle shop in Licking County in the 1980s

data.event: His parents had operated what Wess said was the largest bicycle shop in Licking County in the 1980s, Mound City Bicycle Shop on Idlewilde Avenue.
“I hope it’s here for the next 40 years,” Matt Henry said.
